org.apache.flink.streaming.api.windowing.policy

Class TimeTriggerPolicy<DATA>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.streaming.api.windowing.policy.TimeTriggerPolicy<DATA>
  • Type Parameters:
    DATA - The type of the incoming data points which are processed by this policy.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, ActiveTriggerPolicy<DATA>, CloneableTriggerPolicy<DATA>, TriggerPolicy<DATA>

    public class TimeTriggerPolicy<DATA>
extends Object
implements ActiveTriggerPolicy<DATA>, CloneableTriggerPolicy<DATA>
    This trigger policy triggers with regard to the time. The is measured using a given Timestamp implementation. A point in time is always represented as long. Therefore, parameters such as granularity and delay can be set as long value as well.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimeTriggerPolicy

        public TimeTriggerPolicy(long granularity,
                 TimestampWrapper<DATA> timestampWrapper)
        This trigger policy triggers with regard to the time. The is measured using a given Timestamp implementation. A point in time is always represented as long. Therefore, parameters such as granularity can be set as long value as well. If this value for the granularity is set to 2 for example, the policy will trigger at every second point in time.
        Parameters:
        granularity - The granularity of the trigger. If this value is set to x the policy will trigger at every x-th time point
        timestampWrapper - The TimestampWrapper to measure the time with. This can be either user defined of provided by the API.
        timeWrapper - This policy creates fake elements to not miss windows in case no element arrived within the duration of the window. This extractor should wrap a long into such an element of type DATA.

      • TimeTriggerPolicy

        public TimeTriggerPolicy(long granularity,
                 TimestampWrapper<DATA> timestampWrapper,
                 long delay)
        This is mostly the same as TimeTriggerPolicy#TimeTriggerPolicy(long, Timestamp). In addition to granularity and timestamp a delay can be specified for the first trigger. If the start time given by the timestamp is x, the delay is y, and the granularity is z, the first trigger will happen at x+y+z.
        Parameters:
        granularity - The granularity of the trigger. If this value is set to 2 the policy will trigger at every second time point
        timestampWrapper - The TimestampWrapper to measure the time with. This can be either user defined of provided by the API.
        delay - A delay for the first trigger. If the start time given by the timestamp is x, the delay is y, and the granularity is z, the first trigger will happen at x+y+z.
        timeWrapper - This policy creates fake elements to not miss windows in case no element arrived within the duration of the window. This extractor should wrap a long into such an element of type DATA.

    • Method Detail

      • preNotifyTrigger

        public Object[] preNotifyTrigger(DATA datapoint)
        This method checks if we missed a window end. If this is the case we trigger the missed windows using fake elements.
        Specified by:
        preNotifyTrigger in interface ActiveTriggerPolicy<DATA>
        Parameters:
        datapoint - the data point which arrived at the invokable
        Returns:
        zero ore more fake data points which will be added before the the currently arrived real element gets processed.

      • createActiveTriggerRunnable

        public Runnable createActiveTriggerRunnable(ActiveTriggerCallback callback)
        In case DefaultTimeStamp is used, a runnable is returned which triggers based on the current system time. If any other time measure is used the method return null.
        Specified by:
        createActiveTriggerRunnable in interface ActiveTriggerPolicy<DATA>
        Parameters:
        callback - The object which is takes the callbacks for adding fake elements out of the runnable.
        Returns:
        A runnable is returned which triggers based on the current system time. If any other time measure is used the method return null.

      • notifyTrigger

        public boolean notifyTrigger(DATA datapoint)
        Description copied from interface: TriggerPolicy
        Proves and returns if a new window should be started. In case the trigger occurs (return value true) the UDF will be executed on the current element buffer without the last added element which is provided as parameter. This element will be added to the buffer after the execution of the UDF. There are possibly different strategies for eviction and triggering: 1) including last data point: Better/faster for count eviction 2) excluding last data point: Essentially required for time based eviction and delta rules As 2) is required for some policies and the benefit of using 1) is small for the others, policies are implemented according to 2).
        Specified by:
        notifyTrigger in interface TriggerPolicy<DATA>
        Parameters:
        datapoint - the data point which arrived
        Returns:
        true if the current windows should be closed, otherwise false. In true case the given data point will be part of the next window and will not be included in the current one.

        Description copied from interface: CloneableTriggerPolicy
        This method should return an exact copy of the object it belongs to including the current object state.
